title: Language Models' Factuality Depends on the Language of Inquiry
author: Tushar Aggarwal (Harvard University), Kumar Tanmay (Harvard University), Ayush Agrawal (Université de Montréal), Kumar Ayush (Stanford University), Hamid Palangi (Google), Paul Pu Liang (MIT), ...
relevance_why: The paper investigates multilingual language models' capabilities, which could inform approaches to improve audio-language model training and evaluation methodology by understanding cross-lingual factual retrieval dynamics in diverse contexts.
background: Evaluating the factual recall capabilities of multilingual language models in different languages to determine their ability to transfer knowledge across linguistic boundaries.
contribution: This paper introduces a benchmark and three novel metrics to assess factual recall and knowledge transferability across languages, highlighting deficiencies in language models' cross-lingual generalization abilities.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied on generic QA benchmarks for multilingual tasks without focusing explicitly on cross-lingual factual knowledge transfer.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a dedicated framework to analyze and quantify the disparities in factual recall and transferability in language models across high-, medium-, and low-resource languages.

key_innovation: Develops specific metrics like the Cross-Lingual Factual Knowledge Transferability Score that focus on language model performance across languages.
real_world_impact: Improves understanding of language models in multilingual applications, emphasizing the need for accurate knowledge transfer, which is vital for equitable AI systems across various languages.
limitations: The study evaluates only 13 languages and does not include proprietary language models, which may display different behaviors.

new_terms.Factual Recall Score: **Factual Recall Score** is a metric that measures the accuracy of language models in recalling specific factual knowledge in response to queries.
new_terms.Knowledge Transferability Score: **Knowledge Transferability Score** quantifies how well a language model preserves factual information across multiple languages.

open_sourcing: The dataset and evaluation framework are publicly available at https://github.com/kmrtanmay/X_FaKT.git.
